name: Cashew Chicken
author: Annita Layton

ingredients.name: whole chicken breasts skinned, boned, and cut into chunks
Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. rice wine or rice vinegar

instructions:
Mix chicken breasts, egg whites, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, salt and 1 tablespoon rice wine or rice vinegar. Marinade for half an hour to overnight. Mix together and set aside, broth, 1 tablespoon cornstarch and soy sauce.
Put small amount of oil in skillet. Fry garlic until brown. Remove and set aside. Fry chicken just until done, but very light brown. Drain and set aside. Drain water, chestnuts, and bamboo shoots. Add vegetables to skillet (along with garlic) and stir 3 to 5 minutes until crisp and tender. Add chicken and broth mixture. Heat through until thick. Sprinkle with cashews and serve immediately over steamed rice.
